description: 1949 Chevrolet 3100 ½ ton 5 Window Pickup

These trucks were part of GMs Advanced Design Series, with more comfort and room.  The cab design was described as having Unisteel Battleship Construction.  These vintage pickups have very strong collector support and are hard to find this nice.  The model was 1 in truck sales in the US in 1953. This particular example is finished in Dark Blue with a Black bench seat and  interior trim.  Powered by the venerable 216 Inline 6 cylinder mated to a 3 speed transmission with column shift.  Safety is enhanced by excellent brakes and suspension, brand new Wide White Wall bias ply tires on 16 inch painted steel wheels with trim rings and center caps.  The bed is finished off with new cabinet grade oak and new polished stainless rub strips.  The grill is chrome and the bumpers are like new.  The great thing is this is the more desirable 5 window cab which was a much lower production vehicle and the desired body style today.  Here is you chance to enjoy this ready to drive icon of Chevy truck design today at a very fair market value.
Features
Powered by a freshly rebuilt 216 CID Blue Flame 6 Cylinder
Easy Shifting 3 speed Transmission with correct Column Shifter
Aftermarket Directional Signals have been added
Electrical System is original 6 Volt that works great
The tires are brand new Firestone 6.50-16 Wide White Walls
Wheels are painted steel with trim rings and Chevrolet center caps
Recently Replated Front and Rear Bumpers</>
Newer Chrome Grill shines great
Functioning correct heater and defroster
Brand New cabinet grade Oak Box Floor with Polished Stainless Rub Strips
Dual Rear Tail Lights and highlighted Chevrolet tail gate with covered chains adorn the rear
Immaculate Black Bench seat Interior
Finished in Mirror Gloss Dark Blue
Inside you will find factory instrumentation a rear view mirror along with a dual outside rearview mirror

It's not just a venerable and sturdy vintage truck that dutifully served as a workhorse during the post-War industrial boom of the mid-'50s. This 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Cameo represented a new direction for generations of pickups to follow, offering a more comprehensive and car-like experience in its interior that would help redefine the pickup genre, as Chevy began to realize that the American car buying public was looking for more than an austere driving environment to go along with solid dependability.

This 3100 has seen more than six decades of life and remains looking undeniably sturdy and road-ready. It's India Ivory shade is the same color it left the factory with all those years ago and it ably accentuates the truck's strong contours, offering a nice shine in the process. The 3100s of this era have a self-assured, forward-inclined, face-like appearance when viewed from the front, formed by their wide set headlights and prominent grille that give this truck the appearance it's leaning into the task at hand, forehead first, and the well-aligned features on this one make that self-assured determination all the more convincing. Red accenting on the pillars to the rear of the windows provides a custom touch. The rugged front and back bumpers sit properly positioned and level, and you'll find all the external ornamentation, including its headlight casings, chrome trim and badging, intact and securely fastened, though we do think some attention would bring the chrome work to the next level. Take a look in back and you'll see the painted red Chevy bowtie adorning the tailgate - combined with the twin chrome bumper guards sitting below, it provides another nice detail to this very appealing vintage truck.

The two-toned, ivory and red interior also remains in its original configuration and has been refurbished to an impressive condition. The bench seat is a nice mix of vinyl and cloth that's well padded and comfortable – flanked by door panels on each side that mimic its textured pattern. Just below, the matching red rubber floor mat appears to have performed its protective function well and shows no major scuffs or tears. In front of the original steering wheel, the dash area has been restored to a clean expanse of two-toned steel, featuring a fan-shaped instrument cluster with a very clear lens, a group of control knobs all properly situated, and the original AM radio. In the only readily noticeable nod to modern convenience, a Vintage Air climate control system sits under the dash to keep you and your passengers comfortable while on the road. The bed area in back carries a matching red color and features straight walls with no protruding wheel wells on its sides - affording substantially more room should you ever wish to have this sturdy truck bear any cargo.

Under its dominant hood, you'll find a 235 cubic inch inline 6 that's topped with a 2-barrel carb, just as this truck started out with back in the mid-'50s, with an also factory-correct 3-speed manual transmission sitting just behind. It's a drivetrain that's weathered time well, also benefiting from an updated carb and air cleaner so that it's starting right up, idling strong and shifting securely. This classic Chevy workhorse sits on a set of 15'' stock rims, outfitted with vintage white wall tires.
If you're in the market for a great looking vintage truck that's been kept in stock condition and is running strong, you need to see this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Cameo pickup. Call today!

1957 Chevrolet 3100 Series Pickup 350 CI V-8 Chevy Engine400 Automatic Transmission w/ 2500 RPM ConverterHugger Orange Exterior over Gray InteriorCustom InteriorFull Set of After Market GaugesPro-ShifterTilt Column and Custom Steering WheelPower SteeringPower BrakesPolished Aluminum ManifoldHolley 4 BBL Carburetor and HeadersCustom Wood BedTow HitchDual ExhaustFlowmaster Mufflers12 Bolt Rear w/ 3.73 Gears1974 Chevrolet Truck Front ClipCompletely Rebuilt Front EndWestern Truck, from Washington StateLocated here in our showroom  WE FINANCE/ DELIVER AND SHIP WORLD WIDE, Power Steering, Power Brakes, Pro-Shifter, Tilt Column, Tow Hitch
Like new all original truck, excellent condition, came from a collector in Canada.
Restored original truck with freshly rebuilt engine. New headliner

So it turns out that trucks make pretty cool rods, as this 1955 Chevy 3100 so ably demonstrates. All the usual tricks work here, and what you get when you're done is a stylish, fun, and surprisingly practical hauler that will attract attention wherever it goes.

First of all, the two-tone copper over white paint is an eyeball magnet, offering a traditional look with a few tweaks to give it a custom look. It's still got plenty of authenticity, don't worry about losing the truck's personality, but the shaved hood ornament and custom pinstriping on the already clean lines of the all-new 3100 really work well. The bodywork, which was already dramatic right out of the box, looks great wearing that soft white paint, which is a little creamy, not a hard, bright white, just as it might have been back in the day. A lot of the original trim is intact, and the grille, bumpers, and hooded headlights are in pretty good shape, highlighting what's arguably the first high-fashion pickup truck; you can see the ties to the passenger car line everywhere you look and that's purely intentional. The bed is still functional, too, with wood planks that are in just the right condition that you won't worry about throwing some tools back there and getting a job done somewhere. After all, isn't that why you own a pickup truck?

The interior has been given a full makeover as well, and the working-class accommodations have been replaced by first-class white and copper vinyl. The late-model bench seat looks like a natural fit in the 3100's cab and has been covered with a period-looking pleated upholstery with copper piping, so it all works well together. A custom center console offers a pair of cup holders and holds the Lokar shifter for the TH350 3-speed automatic transmission underneath. Black carpets are the right choice in a truck and keep it from being too soft, and the matching door panels have been as nicely finished as the seat. The stock gauges are still monitoring the engine, along with a white-faced temperature gauge built into the center stack. There is no radio, but it's ready for the entertainment system of your choice, and sometimes starting from scratch is easier than fixing someone else's mess. Finishing it off is a late-model tilt steering column with a rather weathered steering wheel that doesn't quite look right, so that's another place where you could add some value and style without spending much cash.

Just as in 1955, there's a small block Chevy 350 V8 under the hood delivering the power. It's functional and pretty stock, save for the Edelbrock 4-barrel carburetor and intake manifold, so there's smooth power available and it never gets fussy. Some smart upgrades make it reliable and comfortable, including an alternator, power steering, and a modern dual reservoir power brake master cylinder. A big radiator up front keeps things cool. An independent front suspension gives the 3100 improved ride and handling without hurting its ability to work as a truck and it channels power back to a 10-bolt rear end with highway-friendly gears inside. Long-tube headers and a dual exhaust system dumps out just ahead of the rear wheels and sounds fantastic. Color-matched truck Rally wheels are a nice touch and they're wrapped in big 265/70/15 BFGoodrich T/A radials that really fill the fenders nicely.
A very cool truck with a lot of performance and charisma for not a lot of cash. Call now!

Bring the Mirrors because this baby is built to show! This is a phenomenal '51 Pickup frame off restoration that was done down to the nuts & bolts. This truck started its life in Oakland California in June of 1951. Anything that could be redone on the truck has been restored. The restoration began in the winter of 2010 and the process was started. With 56 boards, 238 bolts, nuts, and washers & 40 screws later this beautiful rare Oak Bed was completed. The bed is a work of art and really makes this just a beautiful truck. In summer of 2011 the entire restoration was complete. Complete with a 235ci Engine accompanied by a Muncie 4-Speed Manual this truck can do what it needs to do! The beautiful inside of the truck is done with black bench seating and phenomenal upholstery. Every detail on this beauty shines and really is a beautiful build. Come take a ride into the 50's. Call us today and let VMS park your dream in your driveway!

Up for sale we have a 1954 Chevy 3100 Rat Rod Pick Up.  This pick up has the old look paired with the newer power train.  In the paragraphs to follow we will give a brief description of the exterior, interior, and heartbeat of the Chevy, but first we would like to tell you a little about us.

Smoky Mountain Traders is a classic car dealer in east Tennessee. We are family owned, operated, and own our entire inventory, no consignments, and only deal in muscle cars and vintage auto. You can count on us to have 70 to 80 cars at all times. We don't have a big show room that our customers would otherwise pay for. So, that's how we can sell for less than other dealers. To contact us for more information, pictures, or any questions call our office at (865)988-8088 or visit our SmokyMountainTraders website.

We will start off with the exterior of the 3100.  The body is straight, but with that being said it does have some rust to give it the look of an old barn find.  It has lettering for detail to make it look like an older service truck.  When this truck was done they replaced the bed floor with all new wood and stainless strips.  It also appears to have had new seals installed around the glass.  The chrome grill shows age as does the bumpers.  The wheels on this pick up is a set of Gray Finish Coys with 18's up front and 20's in the rear with new tires.

Next, we will take a look at the interior of the Pick Up.  On the inside it has all been redone.  The seat has been recovered in the correct style vinyl.  Also new carpet and a headliner board was installed.  When you look at the dash they replaced the steering column with a brushed aluminum tilt and added a Banjo Wheel.  The factory style gauges were left and they added a set of Pro comp under dash gauges and a tach.  A short console was installed and it houses the Lokar Shifter.

Finally, we will take a look at heartbeat of the Chevy.  Under the hood the firewall and inner fenders look like the body.  But the power comes from a late model fuel injected 4.8/5.3 Engine that's mated to a 350 Turbo Trans and a 10 Bolt Rear End.  The frame under this Truck is from an S10 with Four Wheel Disc Brakes that are Power along with Power Steering.  The fuel system has been replaced with an Aluminum tank with new lines and pump.
If we can help you in any way with questions or a specific picture, you can call our office at (865)988-8088. Or feel free to call Devvin at (865) 256 2366, or you can e-mail us at
[Email Dealer]

Looking for an eye catching classic pickup truck?  This is it!  Carefully restored recently with no area overlooked, this truck features glass-like paint covering all-metal body panels, a wood-slat bed, an interior upholstered in Saddle leather that looks great with the Metallic Green paint, a nicely detailed engine bay, and a very clean underbody.  Radial tires mounted on the classic Chevrolet wheels make the ride a little more comfortable.

This pickup has one really cool design feature that was done away with after '53; the split windshield.  This feature along with the chrome horizontal slat grille, curved fenders, simple hubcaps, and stamped tailgate are unmistakably classic Chevrolet styling.

We are offering a fully restored Chevrolet 3100 that offers no excuses and sits low. This truck was completely redone just a few years ago using all top brand components; the body is sound and the paint is free of any major imperfections. It will definitely stand out in a crowd, as it is a head turner. It drives GREAT and is tastefully lowered 6'' and sits on 15'' AMERICAN RACING wheels wrapped in FUTURA super sport tires. It is powered by a STRONG V8 with a mild cam and other nice mods that is mated to a 3 speed automatic TH350 transmission.

This BEAUTIFUL truck has undergone extensive bodywork that includes a professionally chopped top, molded headlights, flush mount door handles, de-badging, extensive smoothing, custom roll pan with integrated tail lights, and all new wood in the bed with a flush mount gas cap.

When you come down to look at it, - and trust us... you WILL want to come check it out - some noteworthy things that you might miss include: upgraded disc brakes, power steering, power brakes, an aluminum radiator, and an upgraded intake.

The interior was tastefully done and beautifully executed by sticking to the red and black color scheme of the truck. The dash is a gorgeous gloss black that is accented by the custom red fabric on the door panels and carpet. You will notice the black leather racing inspired seats with red stitching and a custom secret compartment with a sliding door behind them. Everything in the truck is awesome and works well together, but needs to be seen in person to be fully appreciated.

The best resto-mods are the purest: they look stock, but offer modern performance and comfort. This 1946 Chevrolet 3100 pickup truck is a perfect example. At first glance, it's a nicely restored old pickup, but under the hood there's a V8 engine, an automatic overdrive transmission, and all the performance and comfort of a newer machine.

Bright red paint is always a wonderful choice for an old pickup. We can all envision a truck just like this, which years ago was working in a field with a denim-clad farmer tossing hay bales into the bed. Today it has been restored to better than new condition. A lot of these were worked to death, but this one seems very solid and clean, so it was probably not a farm mule and survived its working years completely intact. '40s pickups have become collector's items in their own right, combining timeless good looks with great drivability, and this one seems to have distilled the essence of that idea into sharper focus. Most of the chrome trim has been retained and looks great, especially with that black trim running along the sides of the hood and cab. The bed is beautifully finished with a varnished wood floor that has a red stain that's pretty darned close to the color of the bodywork, and it looks awesome!

Inside, the basics are a little less basic than they were in 1946. Although the goal was to make this a truck capable of cruising like a modern vehicle, the builder didn't want to lose the flavor of a vintage machine. So there's a bench seat, still upholstered in simple black vinyl, and the original metal dash has been restored, not modified. However, inside the gauge panel you'll find the original speedometer flanked by modern gauges, which is a neat touch. The big three-spoke steering wheel is original equipment, too, now vanished with a black leather wrap to give it a more luxurious feel, and there are red accents throughout the interior to tie it all together neatly. Carpets replace the original rubber mats and the original under-dash heater remains, a nice nod to the past. There's also an AM/FM radio hidden out of sight and a custom handle on the shifter so it looks like the original 3-speed manual but actually manages a TH400 3-speed automatic transmission.

The original six-cylinder engine and stump-pulling gears are long gone, replaced by a rebuilt 283 cubic inch V8. However, the goal wasn't tire-shredding horsepower, but rather comfortable cruising without disturbing the character of the original vehicle. In that regard, it is extremely successful. The engine runs without a fuss, inhaling through a 4-barrel carburetor up top and exhaling through a great-sounding dual exhaust system. There's plenty of shiny stuff on the engine, including a stainless firewall, but you can tell that it was built to cruise first and foremost. Up front, the suspension is stock, which means a rigid axle, but it has been upgraded with front disc brakes. A 1963 Nova donated its rear end and it carries a more street-friendly set of gears so this pickup can cruise all day at highway speeds. Chrome Cragar wheels wearing 235/60/15 blackwall radials give it a vintage hot rod look.
So if you're attracted to an original truck but would like to have one with a wider operating range and the comforts of a modern machine, here you go. Call today!

Bright chrome, windshield sun visor, tall whitewalls, patina, and that great art deco color make this 1950 Chevrolet 3100 seem like the perfect time capsule.  But when you notice lowered suspension and hear the sound of the V8, you realize this classy pickup is also custom cruiser.

This Chevy just gets cooler the longer you look at it.  That's because it features just the right amount of patina to make people take notice.  It might have the look of worn-in, but there was a solid investment in getting this to look like a barn find.  You know that immediately as you inspect the quality of the bright turquoise paint and how everything is smooth over the Chevy's famously rounded fenders.  Plus, this tall truck has a huge silver chrome streak, with pieces like its wraparound bumper and legendary five-bar grille that stand out like a pristine art deco skyscraper.  There's even plenty of brightwork complementing the real wood truck bed.  And while this one has a great vintage appearance, this one also gives plenty of hints that it's a custom build.  After all, while you might be admiring those color matched steelie wheels with whitewalls, you also can't help but notice they tuck under the body for a lowered, more aggressive stance.

Inside, the turquoise returns on all the metal parts, but it's now joined by some terrific brown vinyl on the bench seat and door panels.  And with carpeting that has matching tan piping, this is truly a premium presentation.  But that hint of barn find attitude is still present on the interior, too, for those who really look for it – anyone else spot the pre-war Ford steering wheel?  Beyond that is a full set of Dolphin gauges, which is another clue to the performance upgrade in this patina pickup.

The standard Thriftmaster six-cylinder engine that came with this Chevy 3100 would never do in a truck this cool.  Instead, it was upgraded to iconic small block power with a 350 cubic-inch V8.  It looks just as ready to show off as the rest of the truck with the shiny ribbed valve covers and air topper.  And even some of the brightwork is part of the mechanical enhancements, too, like the pulleys and aluminum radiator.  And we know you love how the block was painted to match the rest of the truck's turquoise.  But more than just look great, this is a powerful package with a Holley Four-barrel carburetor and Weiand intake.  There's also a lot of comfort in this classic, including a TH400 three-speed automatic transmission and power steering.  Plus, the front end is a far more modern setup with an independent suspension that features sway bar front disc brakes.

A terrific all-around presentation with all the right upgrades makes for an iconic classic with plenty of modern appeal.  A turn-key package like this is so irresistible, you know you need to hurry to grab this Chevy.  Call today!!!
